fulgoni-etal-2016-empirical.title: An Empirical Exploration of Moral Foundations Theory in Partisan News Sources
fulgoni-etal-2016-empirical.author:
Fulgoni, Dean  and
Carpenter, Jordan  and
Ungar, Lyle  and
Preo{\c{t}}iuc-Pietro, Daniel
fulgoni-etal-2016-empirical.paperMotivationText: News sources frame issues in different ways in order to appeal or control the perception of their readers.
fulgoni-etal-2016-empirical.paperContributionText: The authors analyze framing in news articles from partisan sources in the US using word counts. Moral foundations are detected using the MFD.
fulgoni-etal-2016-empirical.paperResultsText: The data exploration confirms that partisan sources frame political issues differently both in terms of words usage and through the moral foundations they relate to. The authors confirm differences in language and moral foundations use between conservative and liberal US news.
